metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7679 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
In Apache httpd 2.2.x before 2.2.33 and 2.4.x before 2.4.26, mod_mime can read one byte past the end of a buffer when sending a malicious Content-Type response header.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7679` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-macro - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.16
libapache2-mod-proxy-html - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.16
No subscription required

apache2 - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.16
apache2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.16
apache2-data - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.16
apache2-mpm-event - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.16
apache2-mpm-itk - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.16
apache2-mpm-prefork - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.16
apache2-mpm-worker - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.16
apache2-suexec - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.16
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.16
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.16
apache2-utils - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.16
apache2.2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.16').
apache2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.16').
